title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 02 October 2012 - XWiki
content:

10:29 <vmassol> good morning  
10:30 <vmassol> I hope jerome will be able to finish the release  
10:30 <vmassol> or maybe one of us should finish it….hmm  
10:37 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <+tmortagne> vmassol: what release ?  
10:40 <vmassol> 4.2 final  
10:40 <+tmortagne> 4.2 seems to be released  
10:40 <vmassol> half  
10:40 <+tmortagne> a big half then  
10:40 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ReleasePlan42  
10:41 <+tmortagne> ok miss some paper work  
10:41 <vmassol> I think we should finish it between ourselves  
10:41 <+tmortagne> the plan is not fully up to date  
10:41 <vmassol> I'm fixing a bug first and then I'll help  
10:41 <+tmortagne> some of thoses point are done  
10:41 <vmassol> it's not?  
10:41 <vmassol> ah ok  
10:41 <+tmortagne> the  release note is ready, the announce is done on ow2, probably other things too  
10:43 <+tmortagne> seems to be all actually  
10:44 <mrvanes> has quit  
10:44 <+tmortagne> updating download pages  
11:01 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:01 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:34 <+tmortagne> guys do we have a more offiicial documentation than   http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/Howtoincreasethemaximumattachmentsize for upload size ? I can't find it  
11:34 <vmassol> maybe the admin attachment page?  
11:35 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Attachments  
11:35 <vmassol> ?  
11:35 <vmassol> (tmortagne)  
11:35 <+tmortagne> indeed I was searching for upload and XAR import  
11:36 <cdop> has joined #xwiki  
11:37 <cdop> ok I got kicked. so again here: i installed xwiki 4.1.4 and when I want to edit a page in IE9 with wysiwyg i get the JS-error: "Effect is not defined". It is located in dragdrop.js / might be a problem from scriptaculous, found some similar reports on google about it  
11:40 <vmassol> cjd: hi, could you check your cia hook for commits since they don't make it anymore here?  
11:47 <@cjd> http://cia.vc/  
11:47 <@cjd> looks like it's down for a while  
11:48 <@cjd> It used to be pretty stable but I think the original maintainers handed it off to some other people.  
11:50 <@cjd> Github does IRC notification but it joins and quits every time there's a commit which craps up your window if you have joins and quits displayed  
11:55 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
11:56 <mflorea> has quit  
11:57 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
12:05 <vmassol> cjd: ok thanks, didn't realize it was down  
12:12 <cdop> how can I search for bugs/issues here http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa ? cant display anything there...  
12:13 <vmassol> cdop: hi  
12:13 <vmassol> just type your query in the quick search bar  
12:15 <cdop> ah ok, that works, thanks!  
12:19 <+sburjan> cdop: I am unable to reproduce your issue  
12:20 <cdop> You use IE9 with Javascript-Error-Reporting on?  
12:21 <+sburjan> cdop: how can I check that ? I know that I used to get errors on the bottom of the page  
12:21 <cdop> Hmm wait, let me find the option :)  
12:22 <cdop> sburjan: you got english version of IE or german?  ;-)  
12:22 <+sburjan> english :)  
12:23 <cdop> ok, so it is in internetoptions -> advanced  
12:23 <cdop> there you can (de)activate display script errors  
12:23 <cdop> (freely translated from the german version)  
12:25 <+sburjan> cdop: found it. But I still don't get any errors popping up  
12:25 <cdop> it occurs when i want to edit a page.  
12:26 <+sburjan> cdop: try clearing your cache  
12:27 <cdop> i tried ctrl f5  
12:27 <cdop> but i will do it manually  
12:28 <+sburjan> wait. I think I got it  
12:28 <+sburjan> yes, I get it also  
12:28 <cdop> ah,.... reproducable.... thank god :)  
12:28 <cdop> <- software dev too ;-)  
12:29 <+sburjan> cdop: did you report it ?  
12:29 <cdop> not yet  
12:29 <+sburjan> don't forget to report it, so we can fix it :)  
12:29 <cdop> wanted to have it "confirmed" first  
12:29 <cdop> ok, gonna report now.  
12:29 <cdop> thx for support :)  
12:29 <cdop> (and the great wiki/cms too :))  
12:30 <+sburjan> I confirm it. but I don't see any affected functionality  
12:30 <+sburjan> I mean, I didn' dig very deeply, but saving the page works  
12:31 <cdop> well no problems, but as a developer you probably have the "display script errors" option in IE activated, so it will be annoying "to wiki" :)  
12:31 <+sburjan> yes. report it please :)  
12:31 <cdop> (well i dont use ie usally anways)  
12:31 <+sburjan> well we support IE9, so issues should be reported :)  
12:41 <cdop> sburjan: I hope it is understandable (got no english IE here): http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1240  
12:44 <+sburjan> cdop: I improved it. Thanks for reporting  
12:46 <cdop> thanks :)  
12:54 <Enygma`> has quit  
12:57 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:10 <Enygma`> has quit  
13:11 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
13:11 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:17 <vmassol> jvelo is back! :)  
13:17 <jvelo> vmassol: yep :)  
13:17 <vmassol> let me know jvelo if you need help to finish the release  
13:17 <jvelo> sorry for the delay finishing the release  
13:18 <jvelo> vmassol: yes I might ask you for some credentials for wikimatrix etc.  
13:18 <jvelo> besides that I should be able to finish  
13:18 <vmassol> let me do wikimatrix now  
13:22 <jvelo> vmassol: when we release a new stable and their is no preview release for next cycle, do we leave the last RC as preview on wikipedia ?  
13:22 <vmassol> jvelo: I remove it usually  
13:22 <jvelo> ok  
13:26 <vmassol> jvelo: done for wikimatrix  
13:26 <jvelo> thank you  
13:45 <vmassol> jvelo: I'm going to handle http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap  
13:45 <vmassol> going to put the new roadmap  
13:45 <vmassol> I'll update the date  
13:45 <jvelo> vmassol: ok  
13:45 <jvelo> thanks. you can force my lock then  
13:45 <vmassol> oh you have hte lock already  
13:45 <vmassol> you can update the date  
13:45 <vmassol> and I'll take over after  
13:45 <vmassol> as you want  
13:45 <vmassol> forcing  
13:46 <vmassol> too bad I wanted us to release in September… :)  
13:46 <vmassol> if had released in september we would have good re what we planned a long time ago  
13:46 <vmassol> (we had said september)  
13:46 <vmassol> by 2 days!  
13:47 <vmassol> ok I'l update the other dates  
13:47 <vmassol> hmm or leave September  
13:47 <vmassol> what date do we consider for the release date jvelo?  
13:47 <jvelo> either 27th of september either today  
13:47 <vmassol> I put today on wikimatrix but maybe we could decide it was releaed when it was on maven  
13:48 <vmassol> ok 27th then it is  
13:48 <jvelo> yes I think it's fine  
13:48 <vmassol> wikimatrix fixed  
13:50 <jvelo> About http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ReleasePlanHelp#HPublishtoMavenCentral  
13:51 <jvelo> the username to add in the sonatype-nexus-staging server section correspond to what username ?  
13:51 <jvelo> my XWiki nexus username ?  
13:51 <vmassol> you need to regster on sonatype's nexus  
13:51 <vmassol> and ask for permission  
13:52 <jvelo> ok  
13:52 <vmassol> https://issues.sonatype.org/browse/OSSRH-2099  
13:52 <jvelo> I think a URL is wrong  
13:52 <vmassol> ah you've already asked  
13:53 <jvelo> yes. but I have no account on their nexus yet. They create it for me ?  
13:53 <vmassol> no  
13:53 <vmassol> you need to create it  
13:54 <jvelo> their is no register link here https://oss.sonatype.org/index.html#welcome  
13:54 <vmassol> it's documented let me find it  
13:54 <vmassol> jvelo: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ReleasePlanHelp#HPublishtoMavenCentral  
13:54 <vmassol> "In order to be able to upload to Sonatype's Nexus you'll need to create an account on http://issues.sonatype.org/ and then ask for publish rights (if you don't have them already) by posting a comment to https://issues.sonatype.org/browse/OSSRH-2099 ."  
13:54 <jvelo> but it says to register on issues.sonatype.org  
13:54 <jvelo> not nexus  
13:54 <vmassol> yes  
13:55 <vmassol> you don't believe it? :)  
13:55 <jvelo> then OK, I'm all set  
13:55 <jvelo> :)  
13:55 <vmassol> ok  
14:02 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:08 <+sburjan> vmassol: I've been investigating a little bit the slowness issue. I tested 4.2-RC1 and 4.1.4 on 2 machines. On one machine, the time was the normal time .. ~30 seconds, and on the other one ~5 minutes. Funny thing is that the normal time machine is actually a VM, which should be weaker than a host machine. and the only difference I spot is the mysql version. Can the performance degrade so badly between 5.1.54 and 5.5.24  
14:09 <cdop> maybe myisam/InnoDB difference?  
14:12 <+sburjan> no, they all use InnoDB. MyISAM is not recommended with XWiki.  
14:14 <vmassol> sburjan: what slowness issue?  
14:14 <+sburjan> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8245  
14:14 <+sburjan> vmassol  
14:15 <vmassol> ok  
14:15 <vmassol> I haven't worked on this so no idea on my side  
14:16 <+sburjan> I have updated the issue with the new findings. I remember you confirmed the issue too, this is why I was asking you ;)  
14:19 <+sburjan> shouldn't we put in the release notes the issues with Oracle ?  
14:23 <vmassol> mflorea: do we have a jira issue for annotations on AWM issue?  
14:24 <+mflorea> I don't know  
14:24 <vmassol> ok addin gone  
14:24 <vmassol> adding one  
14:24 <+mflorea> wait, let me check  
14:24 <vmassol> actually it might be the same as http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-6328  
14:26 <+mflorea> maybe, the issue is not specific to AWM  
14:26 <+mflorea> afaiu, any page with html macro is affected  
14:27 <vmassol> devs, can you all review http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap and create/list the jira issues you're going to work on for 4.3?
